para0.title: Introduction.
para0.para: The following paragraphs provide information on the Theory of Operation for the CDA Control Logic B. Part information is also provided in paragraph 3-4.2 Part Information.

subpara1.title: Theory Of Operation.
subpara1.para: The CDA Control Logic B CCA works in concert with the CDA Control Logic A CCA and contains the commander and gunner circuitry which generates the controls and status lights for various elements of the CDA. It also contains most of the control logic modes for the turret systems. It contains a power supply that provides + and - 15 VDC used to activate the azimuth and elevation servo valves and to bias various circuits in the electronics. In addition, the CDA Control Logic B CCA generates control and annunciator signals for the fire control system.

subpara2.title: CDA Control Logic B Equipment Description.
subpara2.para: The CDA Control Logic B CCA contains surface mount resistors, capacitors, IC chips, diodes, transistors and relays. Connection to the CDA chassis are made through the J1 connector.
